New Records: LeBron James passed Michael Jordan for the most 30-point games in NBA history
LeBron James moved into fourth in the most number of games played in the NBA
Key Match Events: The Lakers took a 14-13 lead with seven minutes and 31 seconds left in the first quarter which they never lost
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James said, "Very humbling. Anytime I’m mentioned with any of the greats, and arguably the greatest ever to play the game, it’s super-cool. It’s someone I idolized in my childhood, and I wear 23 because of him. So to know that I can sit here and be in the room or in the conversation or whatever it is, you mention MJ, it’s like super-duper dope for me."
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Davis returned from a one-game absence with an ankle problem
Others: Aaron Wiggins went on to score 15 of his 19 points
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, who top-scored on 33 and Jalen Williams, who added 20, also guided the Thunder to a victory
